page.title: 09TRANSPORT, PETWORTH RURAL NE
page.content: For transport, cars and landrovers are depended upon, with bicycles for local trips. The nearest public buses are at either Kirdford or Wisborough Green, connecting with Billingshurst or Petworth. One or two cars per household is usual but, where there are adult children such as at Bulchins, there may be one for each! The easily accessible main road, A272, runs westward to Petworth, east to Billingshurst. Cars are essential, not only for social calls, but for bulk shopping to stock the freezer, or for wives who have part-time jobs in the villages or towns. The nearest railway stations are at Pulborough and Billingshurst. Fortunately for the peace and tranquility of the district, no air lane passes over this area.
